intro: Discocalyx dissecta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved discocalyx, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely dissected, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in umbels. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
